intro: Machaeranthera juncea, commonly known as the narrowleaf prairie violet, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Violaceae family and typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky soils. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, violet-blue flowers with five petals. It is characterized by its erect stem and is often found in disturbed or sunny environments. Machaeranthera juncea plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of native plant communities.
